benchmark_details.name: LLM-GLOBE
benchmark_details.overview: The LLM-GLOBE benchmark evaluates the cultural value systems of large language models (LLMs) by utilizing cultural psychology theory and the empirically-validated GLOBE framework, comparing the values of Chinese and US LLMs using a novel evaluation methodology.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation of the cultural values embedded in LLM outputs and to enhance the understanding of cultural alignment in AI systems.

data.source: Evaluated outputs from Chinese and US LLMs using the GLOBE framework.
data.annotation: Responses scored based on cultural dimensions via a panel of LLM jurors.

metrics: Cultural dimension scores based on GLOBE framework
methodology.calculation: Scores calculated using least squares regression for juror assessments.
methodology.interpretation: Scores reflect the cultural values embedded in model outputs as analyzed through two distinct prompt types (closed-ended and open-ended).
methodology.baseline_results: Cultural dimension scores from the 2004 GLOBE survey serve as baseline comparisons.
methodology.validation: The scores were validated against human ratings for consistency.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark compares cultural values between models trained in the US and China, with potential demographic implications for cultural representation.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential cultural misrepresentation and bias in AI outputs.
